title: A lawyer for unifund won a judgement against me for 22000, my bank account is levied i had 21000 in it, my lawyer said i can
question: file for bankrupcy chapter 7 as i have no assets of real value, i am down to my last 1000 dollers,i just started a new job and dont want to file for bankrupcy if i can avoid it.my lawyer said my money is being held by the sheriffs dept, the wild card in ca is 23250 he said it could take 60 days but is 99% sure the money will be returned to me as i have nothing else.he is filing tomorrow, the lawyer for unifund will be notified asap and the sheriffs dept of the automatic stay, will this lawyer settel? as he most likely get nothing when i go chapter seven, any idea what he might settel for? thank for any info.
answers:
Avvo attorneys are really smart and really caring, but we can't read minds and have no crystal ball.

Why offer more than the attorney's fee and costs needed to file the bankruptcy?

Best wishes for a favorable outcome, and please remember to designate a best answer.
You can evaluate whether a motion for vacating judgment could work.

Will the attorney contest the dischargeability of the debt? If there is no legal basis to do so – no. If, on the other hand, the judgment is for fraud or there is some other basis to contest your discharge – probably yes. If the judgment is just your standard run of the mill judgment for money it will be discharged in your BK.

Whether or not the judgment is dischargeable you should get 100% of your money back provided it is 100% exempt. It may take awhile because of the levy. I understand this is a very recent levy and the bank many not have transferred any money to the levying officer. Your lawyer, who is familiar with your financial circumstances and the facts, is the one to advise you.
